title: International Rugby Board World Cups
content:
Hi everyone,  
Can anybody help me to identify the font used by the IRB in most of the Rugby World Cups logos?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [rugby\_world\_cup\_2015\_logo\_ban\_by\_grantskene-d4awdz2-580x360.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130227064620/http:/typophile.com/files/rugby_world_cup_2015_logo_ban_by_grantskene-d4awdz2-580x360.png) | 138.96 KB |
author: alex_spain

comments.content: I found out already that the numbers are a "Dairyland" but the text is another font I haven't found yet...

“RUGBY WORLD CUP” looks almost like Frutiger, though not quite.  
“ENGLAND” could be Handel Gothic.  
The numbers look custom-made, and not very well at that.  
[Edit:] Unless it’s available in more weights than the one on MyFonts, the numbers are _not_ in Dairyland. They are too thin.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Dairyland/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130227064620/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Dairyland/fonts/)

Should be their corporate typeface simply called "RWC" and, according to this [previous discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20130227064620/http:/www.typophile.com/node/84132#comment-479129), designed by [Witekite](http://web.archive.org/web/20130227064620/http:/www.witekite.com/). It somehow mixes influences from [Handel Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130227064620/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/handel+gothic) (as suggested by Mans) and [Akagi](http://web.archive.org/web/20130227064620/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/akagi).
